October 24, 1956
Mr. Thomas B. Maclin, Jr.
Director, Radio-Television
Mississippi Southern College
Station A, Box 52
Hattiesburg, Mississippi
Dear Mr. Maclin*
Reference is made to your letter of October 11, requesting information about the
possibility of Active membership in the NA3SB for your wirednwireless station, WMSU.
As Mrs. Etryner pointed out in her letter of October 15, such stations are not
eligible for Active membership, such membership being restricted to actual educa¬
tional, non-commercial broadcast stations. I am enclosing a few brief items which
give some information at»ut t^ie Association and which more clearly explain the
classifications of membership.
I would guess that Mississippi Southern College does not do regular educational
broadcasting over a coonarcial station, and therefore would not be eligible for
Associate membership. However, the College would be eligible for Affiliate
membership, and I am enclosing an application blank for your use in applying for
such membership. As a EBmber-based organization all applications must be approved
by the Membership e omit tee and the Board of Directors and such action takes
several weeks. Therefore, if you would like for me to return the check for $15*00,
which you mention is being forwarded, 1*11 be happy to do so. On the other hand,
if you would like for us to hold the check until your membership is approved, we
will do that} and since Affiliate membership is only $10.00 a year, we could apply
the extra $5*00 to next year's dues (1958).
Under separate cover I am sending you some examples of the types of reports, surveys,
etc., which we issue for our membership from time to time, and we are looking forward
to your application for membership. If, in the meantime, we can be of any service,
please do not hesitate to let me know.
Sincerely,
Harold E. Hill
Associate Director
